intro: Barnadesia lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf barnadesia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in tropical and subtropical regions. Barnadesia lanceolata is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and bloom.
